title: Just looking for something to be done about an inter.
body: If someone proceeds to run it down a lane after we just pinged them and told them it wasnt good to take a buff from a teammate what should I do? I already reported him using the in game client, just wanna make sure he understands he shouldn't do something like that ever again. Could use some advice, does blocking make it so I dont ever match with that person again?

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in media, it is not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

Tbh reporting is the best and main way for something like this. I love and appreciate that members of the community want to self guard the community they love from experiences like this. All I can say keep reporting instances :)

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/F4kqKEIm-1-week-later-the-4-inters-have-not-been-banned-support-tickets-are-useless hey riot guy check this out please thanks.

btw, i checked just again, its now 3 weeks and ALL of them are still playing. even the 4th guy who took a 3 day break

This is why more Rioter's don't come to the boards.

Bazerka is in the HR (i think) department (regardless, he's not Player Behavior). He has absolutely nothing more he can say/do about that than any other player on the boards does. Yet you decide to spam his "inbox" (replies) with a reply that's not only off topic for the thread but is hijacking this thread.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-19T22:01:24.001+0000)

Yet you decide to spam his "inbox" (replies) with a reply that's not only off topic for the thread but is hijacking this thread.

its alright, I appreciate the sentiment but its totally ok. @Jennifer420, tbh I have no clue. Those types of things are tracked in a system and handled by a dept that I dont have access too. Unfortunately, Rioters dont have a God tool they can use to check status of things (contrary to popular belief). Sry friend :X

> [{quoted}](name=Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=0000000100000001,timestamp=2019-08-19T23:14:47.830+0000)

Unfortunately, Rioters dont have a God tool they can use to check status of things (contrary to popular belief). Sry friend :X

Wow, I mean, its a shame you have no clue about PB, but ah, I think you are the first red to post in the PB forums in LITERAL years.

Its definitely been 3 years since the last PB related feature, any advise on how to drum up some interest in fixing trolling / inting / feeding?
You... just gonna do Tantram dirty like that aren't you.

oh no a rioter comes to the boards, posts in player behavior once in a year AND I DARE TO ASK FOR SOME INSIGHT/HELP HOW COULD I!
please forgive me. i'll call my parents and tell them they failed at raising me to a decent human being.
That is like you going to Whole Foods and asking for help building the table you got from Ikea.
nope its like me going to ikea and asking some guy working in the office at ikea how to build the table.

Okay, so even if we use your example, that guy does not work in the customer support department, nor do they work in the department that designs instruction manuals, etc... so no, it's not appropriate.

Again, you are the reason that people like Riot Tantram and others likely stopped posting here. They didn't want to deal with people like you hijacking their posts.

sucks. if the support/feedback would do a better job i guess this wouldnt happen. but hey i just take the blame cause im a big boy.

just saying, in my old job where i also was in customer support, if i didnt know something i searched out the person to talk to to get an answer.
just saying.

If your customer had an issue with whatever product or service your company was providing, you wouldn't go ask some in IT, Facilities, or HR about the problem, because **they are not able to help you**.

yeah thats exactly what i do. im the FRONT desk. and if i get for example an email as FRONT desk, its my job to find out who can give me an answer within my company. 
especially in a larger company where theres 100 different teams, noone goes through the trouble of finding the team he needs as customer (especially when the page gets updated maybe twice a year like in leagueoflegends.com case) they just look for the front desk send an email there and its the front desks job to find the answer.

You are missing the goddamn point completely. Let me make it simpler for you.

If you were at the front desk and someone asked for the Marketing Manager, you would not go speak with the IT Director.

Bazerka is not a random Riot employee handling customer service. He told you what his role is, and that he has nothing to do with the Player Behavior team. Your avenue to contact them is a support ticket.

never said he is. as rioter he still might have some insight or can call someone. 

also a support ticket? bro did you even read my post? lol.
its literally proof that noone can deny that support tickets do nothing.

> its literally proof that noone can deny that support tickets do nothing

I'm my company's network ops manager. Part of my duties is overseeing the help desk. This is the response that people give when they **don't get the answer they want**. You unfortunately can't always get what you want.

Or...you can accept the fact that whatever you think should happen isn't going to happen.

"RITO PUNISH THESE PEOPLE THEY'RE STILL PLAYING." Is the equivalent of the, "I NEED A NEW COMPUTER NOW." shit that I have to deal with.

People out on the floor don't decide when the company spends money on equipment. Players don't decide when other players get punished.

Try to enjoy the game.

Oh tell then wise man does ever happen that company doesn't care about problem at all?Does it EVER happen that company give 0 fucks to investigate customer complaint or it is always customer fault ,because he had wrong expectations... I love your one sided inbox thinking
A question i should ask tho. Do riot games HAVE a player behaviour team? Do they care ? Did they ever unban an account , did they ever fix something ? I'm waiting for some proof tho :)

> [{quoted}](name=Vilkiss,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=000000010000000000000001000000000001000000010001,timestamp=2019-08-27T17:31:34.937+0000)
>
> A question i should ask tho. Do riot games HAVE a player behaviour team? Do they care ? Did they ever unban an account , did they ever fix something ? I'm waiting for some proof tho :)

A quick google search brought me this thread;

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/3ljjOHdW-if-i-got-a-ban-but-the-ban-was-reverted-can-i-still-get-the-end-of-season-rewards-in-february?sort_type=recent

Where if the OP is to be believed they had a 14-day ban reverted.

Bazerka isn't the front desk.

He. Is. A. Recruiter.

I am not sure what part of that you don't understand. The fact he is posting on the boards does not make him a support person nor a front desk person.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=00000001000000000000000100000000000100000000,timestamp=2019-08-20T01:17:02.846+0000)

> 
> He. Is. A. Recruiter.
> 
> I am not sure what part of that you don't understand. The fact he is posting on the boards does not make him a support person nor a front desk person.

before you get too carried away, this was posted by bazerka

- I'm actually not a recruiter anymore (I'm too lazy to get my tag changed :P). I moved into a product management role on a new team and I'm really loving it!
You are not in charge here, and nobody has to leave because you command them.
Ah so you defend him. Gotcha. Your also not in charge either. So don't be pointing fingers at me or other people on this forum post.

"I know you are but what am I?"

Classic comeback, bro.
Don't hijack other peoples' threads. Forum rules still apply whether a Rioter is here or not.

Report to Riot support, then if they say "we will look into it" and close the ticket, reopen them and tell them "it seems like reporting to you guys doesn't mean shit because those fuckers are still playing. I guess I can make a smurf and troll everyone else too to let my anger out since nothing is gonna happen."

I shit you not, this is what I said after I reported someone for hardcore inting (the real inting not just having a bad game) and the guy didn't play for 2 weeks lmao

(actually this is what I said in the first report and after realising they did jackshit I just reopened and said the same thing but focused on it.)
that seems like a great idea thank you i will try that.

It does not depend on what you say...It depends on person who lock in report-does he have time to investigate all those reports and does she rely care.They are not all the  same.Some of them care about reports, others do not.And  There is many factors included in their decision should they investigate or just drop the case on the spot and what you say or do will have very small impact on that decission

Oh common be honest. After-game reports are meaningless in 90% of time. Specially if it is report on intentional feeding.The Program that your company use to detect feeders or trolls is not good.Actually any program that need to detect human behavior or motivation behind it  would suck,because it is humans job to understand and judge other humans behavior.Program  can newer deliver justice,at list until humans create artificial intelligence -which will happen - newer :)

Hi zero. Missed you. 

What's new? 
Why are you still recruiter and what is your real title right now? 
You deal with anything PB related that you can share?
You play TFT and how you enjoying it?
Are there any recent thunder dome fun stuff?
That Riot fighting game that was hinted before, can you hint some more?

Just wanted to engage you in a chat, if you can't answer then just say so. No hard feelings.

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2019-08-19T23:05:23.208+0000)
>
> Hi zero. Missed you. 
> 
> What's new? 
> Why are you still recruiter and what is your real title right now? 
> You deal with anything PB related that you can share?
> You play TFT and how you enjoying it?
> Are there any recent thunder dome fun stuff?
> That Riot fighting game that was hinted before, can you hint some more?
> 
> Just wanted to engage you in a chat, if you can't answer then just say so. No hard feelings.

Whats up!
- I'm actually not a recruiter anymore (I'm too lazy to get my tag changed :P). I moved into a product management role on a new team and I'm really loving it!
- Not doing anything PB related, sorry :(
- I am playing TFT! I really enjoyed it, and played it a ton when it first came out (see: the honeymoon effect), but now that its settled down I've moved back to playing ranked League. Nothing else really hits that niche for me. I'm also playing a lot of F1 2019 (yes I'm into driving sims :D)
- Can't really talk about thunder dome stuff XD
- I can hint that Riot is making a fighting game. ;D

Mehhhh .. I just realized that auto correct killed you your name to zero. 

Obviously i meant Zerk, and (I hope you know) that I say that often.

How about if somebody consistently has scores of 3/15/2 we make them go into a forced gulag of 5-10 normals games before they are able to enter ranked again? 3 out of 5 games having trash scores like 1/6/3 5/15/8 (basically KDA < 0.5 and deaths above 11) auto normals. That will stop the inting really quickly. Checked every 5 games.

> [{quoted}](name=Toxic Zyra Main,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=00000006,timestamp=2019-08-22T17:39:29.044+0000)
>
> How about if somebody consistently has scores of 3/15/2 we make them go into a forced gulag of 5-10 normals games before they are able to enter ranked again? 3 out of 5 games having trash scores like 1/6/3 5/15/8 (basically KDA < 0.5 and deaths above 11) auto normals. That will stop the inting really quickly. Checked every 5 games.

I'm no lawyer, but I think this comes dangerously close to contravening the Geneva Convention xP

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=000000060000,timestamp=2019-08-22T17:47:18.045+0000)
>
> I'm no lawyer, but I think this comes dangerously close to contravening the Geneva Convention xP

But it's a game... lol you do know what the Geneva Convention is... right?

That's actually what Dota does, if you get reported for trolling/flaming/inting and you do it you are forced to play and WIN draft games , where you recieve 3 random heroes you can select yourself from out of the hero pool.

The thing is, why waste the time and effort to implement such a feature that would be used so little?

'Cause there is only two ways to **CONSISTENTLY** get such bad stats: inting/trolling, and being over-ranked. And in both cases, there are already existing features to solve it.

In the first case, you don't want people forced in Normals, you want them punished, and that's why reports are for.
And in the second case, they will get demoted pretty quickly anyway, at least much quicker than they would improve in Normals. You don't want them to be forced to "train" in Normals, you want them to be matched against lower opponents, and that's what MMR is for.

> [{quoted}](name=Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-19T19:54:07.434+0000)
>
> Tbh reporting is the best and main way for something like this. I love and appreciate that members of the community want to self guard the community they love from experiences like this. All I can say keep reporting instances :)

TBH we're at a point where punishments for players reported in serious cases needs to be disclosed. I honestly have little faith in the system, and I legitimately believe no one's being banned, even in the most extreme instances.

> [{quoted}](name=Leona Helmsley,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=00000005,timestamp=2019-08-21T22:44:21.007+0000)
>
> TBH we're at a point where punishments for players reported in serious cases needs to be disclosed. I honestly have little faith in the system, and I legitimately believe no one's being banned, even in the most extreme instances.

If you were reported and banned, would you want your records of why publicly posted with names, instances, etc? The hit to player trust far outweighs the gain of satisfying a players immediate sense of "karma". However, I'll acknowledge karma feels good sometimes.

> [{quoted}](name=Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=000000050000,timestamp=2019-08-21T23:34:11.180+0000)
>
> If you were reported and banned, would you want your records of why publicly posted with names, instances, etc? The hit to player trust far outweighs the gain of satisfying a players immediate sense of "karma". However, I'll acknowledge karma feels good sometimes.

Yes. 

It's not like you're posting name/address/phone number of the person.

I've only ever received a 10 game chat suspension, ever. I still have no idea what I did or said to lead to that. I still don't know how that situation came up. 

It would give me much solace to narrow down that situation and see what exactly it was that lead me to that situation. I behave the same every game plus or minus one year, but there was one instant where I got a 10 game suspension and never before or after that with no behavior change. 

That's just a personal opinion though, I know you disagree. But when people report, and have no idea what the outcome of the report was, then see them again a few hours later, days later, weeks later, it really begs the question for some people (myself included) if Riot even does anything about it. And it happens time and time and time again from the posts I read and the game I experience.

> [{quoted}](name=Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=000000050000,timestamp=2019-08-21T23:34:11.180+0000)
>
> If you were reported and banned, would you want your records of why publicly posted with names, instances, etc? The hit to player trust far outweighs the gain of satisfying a players immediate sense of "karma". However, I'll acknowledge karma feels good sometimes.

You know what? Yes. 

If I acted an absolute fool in game and said some inflammatory and racist/sexist/homophobic/equivalent nonsense, then I deserve to be named and shamed for that. The easiest way to deter from that sort of embarrassment is to simply not do it. Yes, people slip up and call people assholes and such, which is debatable, but when you get to the slurs portion of things, it needs to be more firm and addressed. To your second point, yes, the karma feels good, but you what doesn't feel good? The overarching sense that despite best efforts by players, nothing is being done about it. 

(I'm aware this isn't your department, so thanks for even responding.)

> [{quoted}](name=Leona Helmsley,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=0000000500000000,timestamp=2019-08-21T23:43:09.066+0000)
>
> You know what? Yes. 
> 
> If I acted an absolute fool in game and said some inflammatory and racist/sexist/homophobic/equivalent nonsense, then I deserve to be named and shamed for that.

Unfortunately that will just mean (forum) post will shift from "hey, this website lists that my teammate was 3 divisions lower than me.  Why does sucky matchmaking put him in my team!" to "hey, this website lists this person that was once banned for flaming got put in my team.  why does sucky matchmaking put him in my team; matchmake him with other flamers instead!" (the player might not have said a single word yet at the time the person checked his teammates and opponents on some website...)  ;-(        I guess seeing the list of bans and reasons at the start of a match might be good for teamwork if there are exactly zero for any of the 5 teammates, but if it's non-zero for any of them, it could drop teamwork way below what it would be if that info _is not available_.

> [{quoted}](name=Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ETlEBRfU,comment-id=000000050000,timestamp=2019-08-21T23:34:11.180+0000)
>
> If you were reported and banned, would you want your records of why publicly posted with names, instances, etc? The hit to player trust far outweighs the gain of satisfying a players immediate sense of "karma". However, I'll acknowledge karma feels good sometimes.

Karma? I call it justice. Better to ensure players that the system is actually working right and maintain THEIR trust than the feelings of a toxic inter/troll.

My trust in it is thin enough when Rito allows a duo go on a month long trolling/inting spree with 250 ranked matches.
Will do, just don't want him to ruin others experiences in the game. Rarely do I see players like that, you guys are doing a great job in keeping the community clean. Thanks for the clarity.
TBH reporting does nothing.
TBH this is blatantly false
At least half my game have people doing something reportable, per the summoner's code. I almost always report them.  How many times do you think I've gotten the IFS?

By your interpretation of the Summoner's Code. Depending on how you interpret some things, they may not match. 

The instand feedback reports are inconsistent by design. You aren't guaranteed to get one, but rhat doesn't mean there is no punishment.
